quotes.quote: There are no wrong notes; some are just more right than others.
There are no wrong notes.
Don't play the notes. Play the meaning of the notes.
If you stopped playing notes, Music would still exist.
There are no wrong notes in jazz: only notes in the wrong places.
Notes fly so much farther than words. There is no other way to reach the infinite.
You can't speak Music with notes alone, but you can speak Music without notes at all!
The silence between two notes is as beautiful and meaningful as the notes themselves.
Great music as much about the space in between the notes as it is about the notes themselves.
Silence is very important. The silence between the notes are as important as the notes themselves.
The easiest way to avoid wrong notes is to never open your mouth and sing. What a mistake that would be.
The notes sound like they're coming from inside your mind... It was the closest thing to a psychedelic experience I've ever had.
It’s not the note you play that’s the wrong note – it’s the note you play afterwards that makes it right or wrong.
The best way to waste your life, is by taking notes. The easiest way to avoid living is to just watch. Look for the details. Report. Don't participate.
In jazz improv, there is no such thing as wrong notes, only notes that are better chosen and it's not about the note you play, it's about the note you play next.
Look at the piano. You'll notice that there are white notes and black notes. Figure out the difference between them and you'll be able to make whatever kind of music you want.
We all do 'do, re, mi,' but you have got to find the other notes yourself.
The Internet is just a world passing around notes in a classroom.
The only notes that matter come in a wad.
There are only so many notes so there must be only so many melodies.
To me, the biggest notes and the longest notes are the easiest notes.
Notes don't make music until you learn to insert silence between them.
In the liner notes, music is fine by itself. It doesn't need any explanation.
Notes, usually to be musical, have to move in or out. They don't sound like clarinets!
If you want to make beautiful music, you must play the black and the white notes together.
We are musical notes emanating from the quantum string section of a grand symphonic orchestra.
Lots of times it really doesn't matter what notes you play, but what notes come before and after a run.
Music is the space between the notes as much as the notes themselves; it's defined as much by silence as by sound.
The ballet embodies the notes of music. And sometimes you almost feel like you can see the notes dance up there on the stage.
Be aware of the high notes, of the blissful faces and their soft messages, and listen for the silent message of a highly decorated gift.
